```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

pacman::p_load(dplyr,ggplot2,tidyr,vroom,lubridate)
```

## Import and read data

```{r }

dg <- vroom::vroom("Airquality/clean_data/airquality_data_full.csv")%>% janitor::clean_names()
df <- vroom::vroom("Airquality/clean_data/airquality_data_clean.csv") %>% janitor::clean_names()
df <- df %>% 
  separate(participant_id,sep="_",into=c("toilet_type","participant_id","sex")) 

dg
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
df %>% 
  filter(participant_id=="001") %>% 
  # filter(activity=="U" & toilet_type == "M") %>% 
  ggplot()+
  geom_point(aes(x=timestamp,y=co2_ppm,colour=sensor))+
  hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum()+
  facet_wrap(~participant_id,scales = "free") ->a
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
